p: The Ryan White Program provides federal funding for low-income PWH and provides support to more than half of PWH in the United States, 63% of whom have incomes below the poverty line [ 63]. Texas has 40 program-funded primary care providers including Harris County, which has 8 [ 28]. A 2015â€“2016 financial assessment in Houston revealed approximately $900 of Ryan White funding per PWH [ 64], which fell far lower than the 6 cities reviewed in a similar time period [ 65]. The Ryan White program is crucial for the EHE success and requires sustained and augmented funding nationwide including Texas [ 63].
